def_cn: (用于名词短语之前，指代已经提及或指明的人或物)
def_en: You use the at the beginning of noun groups to refer to someone or something that you have already mentioned or identified.

def_cn: (当名词后接 of 短语或表明身份的从句时，该名词前用the)
def_en: You use the at the beginning of a noun group when the first noun is followed by an 'of' phrase or a clause which identifies the person or thing.

def_cn: (用于某些表示人们共有经历的名词前)
def_en: You use the in front of some nouns that refer to something in our general experience of the world.

def_cn: (用于和日常生活相关的人、物、服务、机构的名词前)
def_en: You use the in front of nouns that refer to people, things, services, or institutions that are associated with everyday life.

def_cn: (用于代替所有格限定词，尤在谈论身体某一部分或家庭某一成员时)
def_en: You use the instead of a possessive determiner, especially when you are talking about a part of someone's body or a member of their family.

def_cn: (用于单数名词前，表示一类人或事物)
def_en: You use the in front of a singular noun when you want to make a general statement about things or people of that type.

def_cn: (谈论是否会演奏乐器时，用于乐器名称前)
def_en: You use the with the name of a musical instrument when you are talking about someone's ability to play the instrument.

def_cn: (用于表示国籍的形容词和名词以谈论一国全体国民)
def_en: You use the with nationality adjectives and nouns to talk about the people who live in a country.

def_cn: (与 rich, poor, old, unemployed 等形容词连用，表示某一类人)
def_en: You use the with words such as 'rich', 'poor', 'old', or 'unemployed' to refer to all people of a particular type.

def_cn: (用于姓氏的复数前，表示一家人或夫妻)
def_en: If you want to refer to a whole family or to a married couple, you can make their surname into a plural and use the in front of it.

def_cn: (用于形容词前，表示其修饰的某个事物)
def_en: You use the in front of an adjective when you are referring to a particular thing that is described by that adjective.

def_cn: (表示拥有为某一特定目的所需的足够的某物)
def_en: You use the to indicate that you have enough of the thing mentioned for a particular purpose.

def_cn: (与某些称号、地名和其他名称连用)
def_en: You use the with some titles, place names, and other names.
You use the in front of numbers such as first, second, and third.

def_cn: (用于表示年代的数字前)
def_en: You use the in front of numbers when they refer to decades.

def_cn: (用于形容词和副词的最高级前)
def_en: You use the in front of superlative adjectives and adverbs.

def_cn: 越…越…(用于两个比较级前，表示其中一个随另一个发生量或质的变化)
def_en: You use the in front of each of two comparative adjectives or adverbs when you are describing how one amount or quality changes in relation to another.

def_cn: 每，一(表示速度、价格、度量等)
def_en: When you express rates, prices, and measurements, you can use the to say how many units apply to each of the items being measured.

def_cn: (表示某人或某物是同类中最有名、最重要或最好的。口语中 the 要重读；书面语中常加下划线或用大写、斜体)
def_en: You use the to indicate that something or someone is the most famous, important, or best thing of its kind. In spoken English, you put more stress on it, and in written English, you often underline it or write it in capitals or italics.
